content: simply easy cowl / scarf by june nemeth this simple cowl / scarf uses 3 basic crochet stitches single_crochet half_double_crochet and double_crochet it also introduces a little lace / filet crochet it s designed to allow the crocheter to follow as written or just do row of the stitches they are most comfortable with materials ● 200 yards worsted weight yarn for a small cowl / scarf 400 yards for a large ● size h hook ● tapestry needle gauge gauge is not important for this project abbreviations st = stitch chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet skip = skip space = space notes ● ch2s do not count as a stitch instructions chain 21 set up row single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each chain across ch1 turn 20 stitches now and throughout note that for row 1-12 you can substitute any stitch you like if you don t want to follow the pattern exactly row 1 single_crochet in first stitch and each stitch across ch1 turn row 2 half_double_crochet in first stitch and each stitch across ch1 turn row 3 half_double_crochet in first stitch and each stitch across ch2 turn row 4 double_crochet in first stitch and each stitch across ch2 turn row 5 double_crochet in first stitch and each stitch across ch1 turn row 6 single_crochet in first stitch and each stitch across ch1 turn row 7 - 12 repeat row 1-6 row 13 *ch1 sk1 half_double_crochet in next st repeat from * across ch1 turn 10 chain space 10 half_double_crochet row 14 half_double_crochet in each half_double_crochet and chain space across ch1 turn 20 half_double_crochet row 15 *ch1 sk1 half_double_crochet in next st repeat from * across ch1 turn 10 chain space 10 half_double_crochet row 16 half_double_crochet in each half_double_crochet and chain space across ch1 turn 20 half_double_crochet repeat row 1 thru 16 until piece measures approx 30 finishing with row 16 repeat row 1 - 6 if you are doing the cowl version then also repeat row 13 - 16 once fasten_off leaving approx 18 length tail for slip stitching the ends of the scarf together if proceeding with the cowl version sew in ends block as desired congratulations enjoy your first crochet scarf / cowl and call yourself a crocheter
